meaningMnemonic: If you <radical>stand</radical> in the <radical>wind</radical> it will be really <kanji>quick</kanji> to knock you over. So quick that you probably won't even know the wind did it. You'll end up standing up only to be knocked over again, just as quick.
readingMnemonic: That <kanji>quick</kanji> wind is quicker than you can say <reading>Satsu</reading>ki (さつ). And "Satsuki" is a pretty quick sounding name already. Go ahead, say "Satsuki" as quick as you can right now. Heck, try it a few times.
